articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Multiple casualties were feared after a barrier broke at a Hindu religious festival, the Maha Kumbh Mela, in the northern Indian state of Uttar Pradesh on Wednesday, The Hindu newspaper reported, citing news agency Press Trust of India (PTI).
articles.title: Casualties feared after barrier breaks at India's Maha Kumbh festival, media reports

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Dawoud Abu Alkas
articles.description: The joy of thousands of Palestinian families who made it back home in north Gaza after a ceasefire with Israel is turning to despair as the cold reality of uninhabitable, bombed-out homes and dire shortages of basic supplies sets in.
articles.title: Joy turns to despair as Gaza returnees struggle to settle in enclave's north

articles.author: John Geddie, Tim Kelly
articles.description: Shipping firms may need to pay a fee to use the Baltic Sea, one of the world's busiest shipping routes, in order to cover the high costs of protecting undersea cables, Estonia's defence minister said on Wednesday following a spate of breaches.
articles.title: Exclusive: Baltic Sea shipping tax could pay for undersea cable protection, says Estonian minister

articles.author: Thomas Escritt, Poppy Mcpherson, Jennifer Rigby
articles.description: Field hospitals in Thai refugee camps, landmine clearance in war zones, and drugs to treat millions suffering from diseases such as HIV are among the programs facing the chop as President Donald Trump contemplates massive cuts to U.S. foreign aid.
articles.title: Trump's freeze on US aid rings alarm bells from Thailand to Ukraine

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. prosecutors on Wednesday moved to end the criminal case against two associates of President Donald Trump for allegedly helping to obstruct a probe into Trump's mishandling of classified documents, a court filing showed.
articles.title: US drops classified documents case against Trump associates, court filing shows

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A plane carrying 21 passengers and crew in South Sudan's Unity State has crashed, killing 18 people, United Nations' Radio Miraya reported on Wednesday.
articles.title: Plane crashes in South Sudan, killing 18, radio report says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Switzerland's government said on Wednesday it planned to ban international adoptions due to concerns about abuses in the practice.
articles.title: Switzerland plans to end international adoptions

articles.author: Dan Peleschuk
articles.description: Ukrainian investigators have opened a criminal case involving Defence Minister Rustem Umerov, a move likely to deepen a standoff in his ministry over arms procurement that could strain Kyiv's ties with important Western allies.
articles.title: Ukraine anti-graft agency investigates defence minister amid procurement dispute

articles.author: Yassin Kombi, Sonia Rolley
articles.description: Rwandan-backed M23 rebels appeared to have consolidated their control over Goma, with eastern Congo's largest city mostly quiet on Wednesday apart from sporadic gunfire in some outlying districts, residents said.
articles.title: Congo's M23 rebels consolidate control over a devastated Goma

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel has received a list of hostages who will be released on Thursday from Gaza, the Prime Minister's office said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Israel receives list of Gaza hostages to be released on Thursday, PM office says
